content:
Let me make it as simple as possible.

Hotmail are refusing to accept mail from Optus. To put it in terms of good old paper mail. The US postal system is refusing mail from Australia. For your perspective and mine, the why is not all that important. All you can do is report the issue to Optus and watch them muddle like they usually do.

I did check a specialist black list group https://check.spamhaus.org/not_listed/?searchterm=211.29.132.42 and they have no reported issues with the sending IP address, so this is a fight between Hotmail and Optus which requires remedial action by Optus.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
Yeah, what appears on web sites is just whatever the programmers decided to show, so not very helpful in this sort of context.

I am guessing because you completely obliterated the domain relevant to the display problem, but I am guessing the server directory in server settings > advanced is not set correctly. Perhaps it should be inbox
creator: MattAuSupport

content: This is how they set up by default.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: Il sito support.mozilla.org è solo un'area di discussione a disposizione degli utenti Mozilla; Non è un servizio di supporto tecnico, ne un canale di comunicazione con gli sviluppatori. Per segnalare un bug usare Bugzilla -> https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/
creator: @next

content: Do you have the display fonts set up correctly? Settings/General/Language & Appearance, Advanced..., set the fonts and sizes with Fonts for: Latin, and repeat with Fonts for: Other Writing Systems. Uncheck 'Allow messages to use other fonts'. Keep the font settings in Settings/Composition at their defaults.
creator: sfhowes

content:
re : and a section at the top which is above the menus with e.g. File... but I would like my File menu at the top, as it used to be.

Note info mentions clicking on 'Open Folder' but I think in Linux that would be 'Open Directory'. It also mentions 'Notepad', but you can use any simple basic Text Editor program.

Supernova 115* - How to move the 'Menu Bar' above the 'Unified toolbar': https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1422908
creator: Toad-Hall

content: Try this: Help/Troubleshooting Info, Profile Folder, Open Folder, close TB, delete or rename session.json, the file that stores the set of open tabs when TB was last closed. See if that cures the problem of tabs not being remembered after a (long) sleep.
creator: sfhowes

content: Select the non-sending account in the left pane of Account Settings, then look at Outgoing Server (SMTP) in the right pane. Click Edit SMTP server... Does the User Name of the smtp match the User Name (email address) of the selected account?
creator: sfhowes

content:
Che metodo di sincronizzazione stai usando? Provider for Google Calendar o CalDAV? https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/come-utilizzare-calendario-google-lightning

Come hai eseguito la configurazione?
creator: @next

content:
duncan24 said
I am trying to add a MS365 mail account to Thunderbird 115.4.2 and keep getting a mail fail message, telling me the login failed, I am receiving mail into this mailbox without issue but sending doesn't work. I get an error message with 3 options, retry, enter a new password or cancel. Enter new password doesn't work. I have set up , as far as I can tell, correctly, the password on the account works for incoming mail. The default smtp server for this mailbox is correct: smtp.office.365.com, port 587, STARTTLS, Oauth2 and my correct mail address for this account. Any thoughts as to what I am not doing? TIA Duncan

Is that a typo in the server name? It should be smtp.office365.com.
creator: sfhowes
